      • getEndpoint

        public void print()
        Prints out the path (using the nodes toString method), separated by a ->

      • subPath

        public Path<T> subPath(int start,
              int end)
                             throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns a subpath specified by its start and end index, both inclusive. When end > start, it returns a subPath starting at end, going to start (in reverse).
        Parameters:
        start - The index to start the subpath from
        end - The index to end.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - When one or both indices are out of bounds.
